definitions.definition: a form of play or sport, especially a competitive one played according to rules and decided by skill, strength, or luck.
examples: pastime, diversion, entertainment, amusement, distraction, divertissement, recreation, sport, activity More"Andrew and his friends invented a new game"match, contest, tournament, meet; final, playoff; deathmatch "the team hasn't lost a game all season"MoreAndrew and his friends invented a new gamematch, contest, tournament, meet; final, playoff; deathmatch the team hasn't lost a game all season

definitions.definition: a complete episode or period of play, typically ending in a definite result.
a single portion of play forming a scoring unit in a match, especially in tennis.
a score of 100 points for tricks bid and made (the best of three games constituting a rubber).
a person's performance in a game; a person's standard or method of play.
examples: he will attempt to raise his game to another level

definitions.definition: a meeting for sporting contests, especially track and field.
sports and athletic activities as organized in a school.
the equipment for a game, especially a board game or a computer game.
a type of activity or business, especially when regarded as a game.
examples: this was a game of shuttle diplomacy at which I had become adept

definitions.definition: a secret and clever plan or trick.
examples: I was on to his little game, but I didn't want him to know
synonyms: practical joke; informalscam; archaicshift "I spoiled his little game"

definitions.definition: wild mammals or birds hunted for sport or food.
the flesh of mammals or birds, used as food.
examples: wild animals, wild fowl, big game she lived off fish and game

definitions.definition: eager and willing to do something new or challenging.
examples: they were game for anything after the traumas of Monday
synonyms: skookum "they weren't game enough to join in"willing
up for it "I need a bit of help—are you game?"

definitions.definition: play games of chance for money.
examples: gamble, bet, place/lay bets they were drinking and gaming all evening

definitions.definition: manipulate (a situation), typically in a way that is unfair or unscrupulous.
examples: it was very easy for a few big companies to game the system
